title: Engineering Manager - Ubuntu for Next-Gen Silicon
description:
We partner with the world's leading silicon vendors to optimise Ubuntu on their latest platforms. We integrate next-generation features and performance enhancements in Ubuntu while also ensuring a common operating experience for their users.
   

  

 We are hiring engineering managers who are passionate about operational systems, cutting-edge hardware and open source technologies to lead the engineering teams working on enabling and optimizing Ubuntu on the latest x86, ARM, RISC-V, s390x and POWER systems.
   

  

 We believe that Engineering Managers should be outstanding developers themselves. They should be completely at home reviewing a patch or a software design spec. They are trusted engineers who understand the importance of a whole-team effort in creating great products, and who enjoy seeing colleagues develop. They should contribute code themselves to set the standard for coding, but know that the code they write is far less significant than their ability to shape the whole team's direction, focus and delivery.
   

  

 An Engineering Manager is responsible for line management and career guidance. The ability to develop engineering talent, to represent your team and product from a technical perspective, and to drive collaboration with other teams and customers are all critical to success in this role.
   

  

 You will be expected to drive healthy engineering practices, documentation, quality and performance optimisations as well as lead your team to deliver high-quality design and code.
   

  

 You will have the opportunity to influence the culture, facilitate technical delivery, and work with your team on strategy and execution.
   

  

 Location: we have remote roles open in every time zone.
   

  

**What your day will look like**
* Lead and develop a team of engineers, ranging from graduate to senior
* Oversee commercial engagements and support timely delivery on agreed project milestones
* Participate as technical lead on complex customer engagements involving complete system architectures from cloud to edge
* Implement disciplined engineering processes
* Integrate and maintain platform-oriented software stacks
* Optimize Ubuntu for latest hardware platforms
* Display technical leadership internally and within our external communities
* Contribute to code reviews and technical documentation
* Be an active part of the leadership team, collaborating with other leaders


**What we are looking for in you**
* An exceptional academic track record from both high school and university
* Undergraduate degree in Computer Science or STEM, or a compelling narrative about your alternative path
* Fluency in C, C++, and Python
* Experience with Debian/Ubuntu or other distro packaging
* Passion for Linux and operational systems software (e.g. kernel, virtualization stacks, graphics or Yocto)
* Experience working with open source communities and licenses
* Experience managing software engineering teams
* Experience working with customers
* Professional written and spoken English
* Excellent interpersonal skills, curiosity, flexibility, and accountability
* Passion, thoughtfulness, and self-motivation
* Excellent communication and presentation skills
* Result-oriented, with a personal drive to meet commitments
* Ability to travel twice a year, for company events up to two weeks each


**Additional skills that you might also bring**
* Computer architecture knowledge of x86, ARM, RISC-V
* Understanding of build systems and toolchains, including for cross-compilation
* Experience with board bring up and validation
* Familiarity with Ubuntu development model
* Performance engineering, benchmarking and profiling
* Experience with one or more of the following technologies: virtualization stacks, confidential computing, RDMA, Infiniband and high performance computing.
* Experience with Docker/OCI containers/K8s


**What we offer you**
 We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Employee Assistance Programme
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
* Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
   

  

**Canonical is an equal opportunity employer**
 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Credit & Risk Solutions Sales Executive
description:
**About The Position**
 Are you a results-driven sales professional with a deep understanding of banking, finance, and technology?
   

  

 Do you thrive in a role where you can actively drive deals forward, manage complex sales cycles, and close high-value contracts?
 *Please, continue reading!*
 We’re looking for a Credit & Risk Solution Sales Executive who can take ownership of selling our Next-gen Credit Scoring solutions to enterprises across various industries and sizes, including financial services, iGaming, Rentals and more! If you’re experienced in handling multi-stakeholder sales processes, tenders, and C-level negotiations—this is your opportunity to make an impact at one of the fastest growing start-ups in Europe,
 **Kreditz**
**Key Responsibilities**
 As a
 **Solution Sales Executive** 
 , you will:
   

  

* International sales targeting tier1 customers
* Lead and manage complex sales processes, including tenders, RFPs, and contract negotiations.
* Conduct presentations and solution demonstrations tailored to clients.
* Develop and nurture relationships with C-level executives, decision-makers, and key stakeholders.
* Collaborate closely with Product and Solution Engineering teams to align offerings with client needs.
* Use data-driven insights and consultative selling techniques to drive long-term value for clients.
* Stay updated on industry trends, competitive intelligence, and evolving financial technologies.


**Who You Are**
* You have 5+ years of experience in complex B2B solution sales, preferably in FinTech, SaaS, or enterprise software.
* You have a strong understanding of banking, finance, and technology, including regulatory considerations.
* You have successfully managed long sales cycles, tenders, and high-value deals by engaging with C-level executives and decision-makers in large organizations.
* You have experience delivering technical presentations and leading consultative sales discussions.
* You excel in both hunting new opportunities and expanding existing accounts.
* You are strategic, data-driven, and always looking for ways to optimize sales performance.


**Candidate Requirements**
* 5+ years of experience in enterprise B2B sales, preferably selling FinTech, SaaS, or complex tech solutions.
* Proven track record of winning large deals and managing high-value sales processes.
* Deep knowledge of banking, financial services, and technology trends.
* Strong experience with tenders, RFPs, and multi-stakeholder sales cycles.
* Proficient in value-based selling techniques
* Excellent presentation, communication, and negotiation skills.
* Ability to collaborate cross-functionally with Product and Technical teams.
* Fluent in Swedish & English


**Meritorious Skills**
* Experience in Open Banking/PSD2.
* Experience from working with credit information within Financial Services
* Additional language skills, German and Spanish
* Experience in selling to banks, financial institutions, or enterprise clients is a strong plus.


**What Can Kreditz Offer**
* Growth Journey: A unique chance to be part of a rapidly growing scaleup where every team member plays a crucial role in the company's success.
* Inclusive Culture: Join a diverse, fun-loving, and collaborative team that celebrates both big and small milestones together.
* Wellness Perks: 24/7 access to an on-site gym, sauna, and sports center, plus a wellness allowance.
